bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, March 19, 1891

div1.p: The endorsement informs Reed that he did not lose his right to commutation of quarters while on a temporary leave of absence. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, March 19, 1891
div1.p:
Informs Asst. Surg. Walter Reed, U.S. Army, that he did not
lose his right to commutation of quarters while on temporary
absence in the field.

Respectfully transmitted to Captain Walter Reed, assistant
surgeon U.S. Army. No. 1122 Madison Ave. Baltimore, Maryland.
By order of the Surgeon General.

Lieut Col and Asst Med Purveyor,
U.S. Army.
